medical_history.chief_complaint: Disabling peripheral neuropathy with severe neuropathic pain and cramps.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began about 8 years ago with pain at the base of the left foot, initially diagnosed as plantar fasciitis. Pain persisted after cortisone injections and spread to the right foot. Neuropathic symptoms including numbness, tingling, pain, and burning bilaterally have worsened over the years. Symptoms worsen when diabetes is less well controlled.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diabetes diagnosed 1 year before EMG findings; chronic conditions include obesity, hypercholesterolemia, depression, and hypertension; previous spinal surgery (L5 to S1 hemilaminectomy, medial facetectomy, microdiskectomy in 2000).
medical_history.social_history: Lives in the greater Boston area and is a registered nurse; struggles with weight and diabetes management.
